title.native: 本好きの下剋上 司書になるためには手段を選んでいられません
title.romaji: Honzuki no Gekokujou: Shisho ni Naru Tame ni wa Shudan wo Erandeiraremasen

description:
Anime adaptation of Part 1 of Honzuki no Gekokujou.

When a sickly young girl suddenly becomes obsessed with inventing new things, her family and friends are all puzzled. "What has gotten into Myne?" they wondered, never dreaming that the answer is not a "What" but a "Who": Urano Motosu, a book-loving apprentice librarian who died in an earthquake in Tokyo who somehow found herself in Myne's body! And since Myne's world is still in a medieval stage, where books can only be owned by the elite, the new Myne intends to do everything she can to bring her beloved books to the masses in the time she has left.

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

Note: The first episode was included in a bonus DVD that came with the limited edition of the 8th volume of Part 4 of the light novel that was released on September 10th, 2019 prior to its TV premiere.
synonyms: Ascendance of a Bookworm: I'll do anything to become a librarian
爱书的下克上：为了成为图书管理员不择手段！
หนอนหนังสือยึดอำนาจ

tags.name: Class Struggle
tags.description: Contains conflict born between the different social classes. Generally between an dominant elite and a suffering oppressed group.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Age Regression
tags.description: Prominently features a character who was returned to a younger state.

tags.name: Economics
tags.description: Centers around the field of economics.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Educational
tags.description: Primary aim is to educate the audience.

tags.name: Orphan
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

tags.name: Josei
tags.description: Target demographic is adult females.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Adoption
tags.description: Features a character who has been adopted by someone who is neither of their biological parents.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Makeup
tags.description: Centers around the makeup industry.

tags.name: Archery
tags.description: Centers around the sport of archery, or prominently features the use of archery in combat.

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

tags.name: Achromatic
tags.description: Contains animation that is primarily done in black and white.

node.description: [Twitter](https://twitter.com/miyakazuki01) | [Syosetu](https://mypage.syosetu.com/372556/)

[Tumblr](https://youshiina.tumblr.com) | [Website](https://youshiina111.wixsite.com/artworks)

__You Shiina__ is a Japanese freelance illustrator. She has done character design and cover illustrations for many Light Novels, children's books, as well as some video games. Formerly a student of famous artist and designer [Range Murata](https://anilist.co/staff/98445).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/megatenhongo) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/本郷みつる)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/柳田義明)

Affiliated with [Ajia-do](https://anilist.co/studio/30/).
Originating from [Ajia-do](https://anilist.co/studio/30/).

__Agency:__ Gekidan Himawari

[Profile](https://profile.himawari.net/view/1622) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/smileysuu) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/sumire__morohoshi/) | [YouTube](https://youtube.com/channel/UCTlieWyDS62ZGG3yMFswS5g) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sumire_Morohoshi) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E8%AB%B8%E6%98%9F%E3%81%99%E3%81%BF%E3%82%8C)

Sumire Morohoshi is a Japanese actress, voice actress and singer from Kanagawa Prefecture. She is affiliated with Himawari Theatre Group, and debuted as a solo singer under the record label Flying Dog.

**Non-Anime Roles**:
- Pela - Honkai: Star Rail (VG)
- Yuni - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Product 08 - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Gallica - Metaphor: ReFantazio (VG)
- Yaiyai Yarucar - Bakuage Sentai Boonboomger (TV Series)

__Blood Type:__ A
__Height:__ 157 cm (5'2")
__Hobby:__ Collecting records, watching professional wrestling
__Agency:__ Stay Luck

[Profile](https://stay-luck.com/talent/nakajima-megumi) | [Website](https://nakajima-megumi.jp) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/mamegu_staff) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCkOGw3UbTMkj8U0VYzdmi5A) | [Anison](http://anison.info/data/person/24277.html)

Born of a Japanese father and a Filipino mother, Megumi was brought up in a "house filled with music" and grew up with the desire to sing.  In 2003, she participated in the "Self Stardust Promotion" contest and passed, thereby affiliating her to the agency. In 2007, she auditioned to the Victor Entertainment sanctioned "Victor Vocal & Voice Audition" and won the role to voice Ranka Lee in Macross Frontier.  She is also the voice provider for the Vocaloid, [Megpoid](https://anilist.co/staff/140519).

She is affiliated with Stay Luck for voice acting and FlyingDog for singing.
[Website](http://michiru.jp/ja/) | [Anison](http://anison.info/data/person/29507.html) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/未知瑠)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/柳田義明)

Affiliated with [Ajia-do](https://anilist.co/studio/30/).
Originating from [Ajia-do](https://anilist.co/studio/30/).
Founder and representative director of Otonarium.

**Residency:** Tokyo, Japan

**Ryou Hirata** is a Japanese animator and designer, who does prop, character and art design.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/209351/)._

__[Blog (JP)](http://ameblo.jp/sira10/)__

__[Blog (JP)](http://ameblo.jp/sira10/)__

__Birthplace:__ Toride City, Ibaraki Prefecture, Japan

__Yuusuke Shirato__ is a Japanese arranger, composer, lyricist and musician.

**Birthplace:** Niigata City, Niigata Prefecture, Japan
**Major:** National History

**[Website](http://www.yuhoiwasato.com/)**

**Iwasato Yuuho** is a Japanese lyricist and essayist (and former singer-songwriter), who is well-known for writing the lyrics to many anime theme songs. She graduated from Chuo University Faculty of Letters, Department of History, majoring in national history.

[Official Website](https://yoshizawakayoko.com/s/y07/?ima=4848) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yoshizawakayoko)

__Kayoko Yoshizawa__ (June 4, 1990) is a singer and songwriter from Kawaguchi, Saitama Prefecture, Japan.

[Official Website](https://yoshizawakayoko.com/s/y07/?ima=4848) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yoshizawakayoko)
